title: Admin membership plan edit/delete controls in MemberManagement

requirements.summary: Add an admin-only membership plan management section in MemberManagement to list plans and support editing and deleting with confirmation and React Query refresh.
acceptanceCriteria: In the Admin dashboard > Members tab, there is a visible section that lists existing membership plans (in addition to the existing ‘create new plan’ flow).
Each listed plan has an Edit action that opens a form pre-filled with the plan’s current values and allows updating name, duration (months), price, and benefits.
Saving an edited plan persists via the existing backend method `updateMembershipPlan(plan : MembershipPlan)` and the UI refreshes the plan list (React Query invalidation).

Each listed plan has a Delete action that requires confirmation and then deletes via the existing backend method `deleteMembershipPlan(id : Text)` and the UI refreshes the plan list (React Query invalidation).
All user-facing text for these plan-management actions is in English (e.g., labels, buttons, dialogs, confirmation prompts, toasts).

file_operations.description: Create a focused admin UI component that: fetches and lists membership plans (using existing React Query hooks), provides an Edit dialog with a pre-filled form (name, durationMonths, price, benefits) that calls `useUpdateMembershipPlan`, and provides a Delete action with an explicit confirmation step that calls `useDeleteMembershipPlan`; show English labels/buttons/prompts and success/error toasts; keep BigInt fields handled safely (string inputs converted to BigInt for saves).

Wire the new MembershipPlanManagement section into the existing admin Members area UI (MemberManagement) so the plan list and edit/delete actions are visible alongside the current create-plan flow; ensure the section renders loading/empty states (e.g., while `useGetAllMembershipPlans` is loading) and that all user-facing text related to plan management is English.

Verify/adjust (without changing immutable hooks) the membership plan React Query hooks to fully support the new UI: ensure `useUpdateMembershipPlan` and `useDeleteMembershipPlan` are exported and invalidate the `membershipPlans` query key on success; confirm error handling surfaces usable messages to the UI layer.
